other_tests.findings: Decreased amplitude of compound muscle action potentials (CMAP) in both peroneal nerves. Absent or mildly prolonged F-wave latencies. Other NCS findings including distal motor latencies and motor nerve conduction velocities were normal.
Active fibrillation potentials, positive waves, and neurogenic polyphasic waves in the right anterior tibialis muscle.
58 cells (18 neutrophils and 17 lymphocytes), glucose 80 mg/100 mL, and protein 60 mg/100 mL.

Day 5 showed questionable nonenhancing hyperintensity in the central pons; Day 13 showed new nonenhancing lesions in both thalami and extensive increased T2 signal throughout the midbrain, pons, medulla, and cerebellar hemispheres.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Increased ADC values were noted in the pons and thalami on Day 13.
